content:
• Friday, February 9, 2018
  • CDK

    CDK +9.4% on chatter Carlyle, Silver Lake are near buyout deal

    • Shares in software maker CDK Global (NYSEARCA:CDK) are up 9.4% after hours with chatter on Bloomberg that Carlyle Group (NASDAQ:CG) and Silver Lake are close to a buyout deal.
    • That deal would be for at least $10B and other P-E bidders reportedly aren't in active talks.
    • CDK, which specializes in automotive and retail solutions, had a market cap of about $9.17B at the close today.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:05 PM | 4 Comments
  • GRUB

    Analysts boost targets on GrubHub after Yum infusion

    • GrubHub (NYSE:GRUB) slipped 3.9% today, giving back some of yesterday's 27% gain spurred by an investment from Yum Brands.
    • The stock move resulted in nearly a dozen price target hikes from prominent analysts -- not necessarily all bulls. KeyBanc raised its target to what looks to be a Street high of $105, implying 23% upside from today's closing price. GrubHub closed at $85.54 today.
    • Meanwhile, Susquehanna raised its target to $87 but stayed Neutral on valuation concerns. Credit Suisse stuck with a Neutral position while raising its target to $80.
    • And Monness Crespi Hardt stayed with its Sell rating, though it raised target price to $65 from $52, now implying just 24% downside.
    • Analyst James Cakmak gave credit where it's due, saying "Our thesis has largely been predicated on increasing encroachment into the food category from tech bellwethers where restaurant allegiances are based on the broadest network with the most competitive rates ... Grub has figured out how to stay relevant in an ever-crowding space.”
    • But valuation is "beyond stretched" now: “Even giving the full benefit of the doubt with a premium multiple leaves the shares still overvalued."
     
     
     
     
    | 5:50 PM | 1 Comment
  • QUMU

    Qumu announces Preliminary Q4 & year end results; shares -2.25% AH

    • Qumu Corporation (NASDAQ:QUMU) expects Q4 revenue in the range of $7.0M - $7.4M {prior guidance: $8.5M - $9.5M} vs. a consensus of $9.07M.
    • Q4 EPS is expected to be in the range of $(0.38) - $(0.34) {prior guidance: $(0.15) - $(0.10)} vs. a consensus of $(0.13).
    • The company expects FY17 revenue in the range of $28M - $28.4M {prior: $29.4M - $30.4M}  vs. a consensus of $30M.
    • FY17 EPS in the range $(1.29) - $(1.25) {prior: $(1.05) - $(1.0)} vs. a consensus of $(1.04).
    • Net loss per diluted share for the Q4 & FY17 reflects $1.5M, or ~$0.16/share, of interest expense in connection with the incremental amortization of deferred financing costs related to modification of the Company’s term note agreement during the Q417.
    • The Company will provide final Q4 & year end 2017 results on March 6, 2018.
    • Shares -2.25% AH
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 5:13 PM

  • Weekly ETF Gainers / Losers (2/9/18)

    • Top gainers: VXX +52.0%. UUP +1.5%. FXY +1.3%. PGF +0.4%.
    • Top losers: OIL -11.8%. FXI -9.7%. USO -9.1%. UNG -9.0%. FCG -8.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM | 6 Comments
  • TROV

    Trovagene's PCM-075 shows encouraging action in preclinical testing; shares up 22%

    • Nano cap Trovagene (TROV +21.8%) is up on more than triple normal volume on the heels of its announcement of encouraging preclinical data on candidate PCM-075. The data were presented at the ASCO GU Symposium in San Francisco.
    • The data showed a synergistic effect from the combination of PCM-075 and Johnson & Johnson's ZYTIGA (abiraterone acetate) in prostate cancer cell lines.
    • A Phase 2 clinical trial evaluating the combination in patients with metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer was initiated last month.
    • Previously: Trovagene launches mid-stage study of PMC-075/Zytiga combo in mCRPC (Jan. 24)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:52 PM | 2 Comments
  • NGL

    NGL Energy Partners -17% as quarterly results propped up by asset sale

    • NGL Energy Partners (NGL -17.5%) plunges despite reporting FQ3 earnings that appeared to exceed analyst expectations as well as a 31% Y/Y increase in revenue to $4.46B.
    • NGL's quarterly net income of $56.8M included the gain on the $108.6M sale of its 50% interest in Glass Mountain Pipeline, compared to year-ago net income of $1.3M.
    • NGL says distributable cash flow in the quarter fell 20% Y/Y to $60.7M from $76M in the prior-year quarter.
    • The Crude Oil Logistics segment generated adjusted EBITDA of $30.3M during the quarter vs. $16.6M a year ago; the Grand Mesa pipeline contributed $43.2M in adjusted EBITDA as physical volumes averaged ~100K bbl/day.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM | 15 Comments
  • FOX

    Comcast CEO plans $5B-plus in buybacks

    • Speaking about free cash flow in the wake of tax reform, Comcast (CMCSA +0.3%) Chairman/CEO Brian Roberts says the company will repurchase at least $5B in stock as a result.
    • "We've said we wanted to change the target leverage to actually be a little bit higher than we've previously said," Roberts says. "So we've talked about 2.2x, previously we've been 1.5 to 2 ... so that's an increase which would suggest that we could do more buybacks.
    • "So we do at least a $5B stock buyback, we increase the dividend 21% ... We want to invest in the business, first and foremost, but we also return to shareholders."
    • Roberts adds in the segment that he'll miss Thursday Night Football, now moving to a much-higher-bidding Fox (FOX +2.9%, FOXA +2.8%), but: "We said when we bought NBCUniversal that we wanted to be financially disciplined with sports. That hadn't always been the case.
    • "And we are sorry to lose it ... We have Sunday night football, which is the No. 1 show on television, and we have that for many more years."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM | 9 Comments
  • VXRT

    Aviragen not quite there with shareholder support for Vaxart tie-up; shares down 4%

    • Aviragen Therapeutics (AVIR -3.8%) has postponed its February 13 special shareholders meeting in order to "provide [its] stockholders additional time to consider the revised deal terms" related to its proposed merger with Vaxart.
    • Under the terms of the original agreement, Aviragen shareholders would own ~40% of the combined company. Under the revised deal, reported two days ago, Aviragen shareholders would own 49% of the combined firm.
    • Previously: Aviragen to merge with Vaxart (Oct. 30, 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:20 PM | 8 Comments
  • MELI

    MercadoLibre falls on Amazon concerns

    • Shares of MercadoLibre (NASDAQ:MELI) are down 2.9% after Reuters reports that Amazon is making a move to lease a huge warehouse outside of Sao Paulo.
    • Sources indicates that Amazon may be looking to handle distribution in Brazil of products purchased off its site.
    • "It’s another signal that Amazon’s push into Latin America is serious," observes Allaria Ledesma analyst Julia Ayzaguer on the development (per Bloomberg).
     
     
     
     
    | 3:04 PM | 10 Comments
  • INPX

    Technology - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2.55 pm (2/9/18)

    • Gainers: INPX +23%. MOBL +20%. PCYG +17%. UIS +17%. INVA +13%.
    • Losers: WEB -18%. SWIR -15%. PSDO -13%. HDP -10%. MYSZ -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM
  • AMZN

    Amazon Studios hires NBC Entertainment president

    • Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) hires NBC Entertainment president Jennifer Salke to run Amazon Studios.
    • Salke will replace interim studio chief Albert Cheng. 
    • Former Amazon Studios head Roy Price left in October after a sexual harassment allegation.   
    • Amazon shares are down 2%.       
    • Previously: Amazon shadow sends FedEx and UPS lower (Feb. 9)
    • Previously: Reuters: Amazon planning Brazilian mega-warehouse (Feb. 9)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:44 PM | 8 Comments
  • FE

    Bloomberg: Trump administration weighing aid for FirstEnergy coal plants

    • FirstEnergy (FE +2.1%) is higher after Bloomberg reports U.S. Energy Secretary Perry is considering using his authority under Section 202 of the Federal Power Act to order coal plants run by FE to remain online “to serve the public interest."
    • The Trump administration last year declined a request from FE and its main supplier, privately owned coal miner Murray Energy, to use the emergency powers to stop coal plants from closing.
    • But Perry may be reconsidering, according to the report, after the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission denied his request to subsidize struggling coal and nuclear plants to reward them for their ability to store energy for 90 days on-site.
    • Spokespeople at both FE and Murray Energy said they were unaware of any impending action but would welcome the support.
    • FE coal-fired plants at risk of closure include Bruce Mansfield in Shippingport, Pa., and W.H. Sammis in Stratton, Ohio.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM | 10 Comments

  • Stocks bounce back from abyss

    • A few minutes ago, it looked like another 1K point down day was in the making, but another major reversal has the averages modestly higher, led by the S&P 500's 0.4% advance.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM | 111 Comments
  • CGG-OLD

    Energy/Materials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 pm

  • FET

    Forum Energy Tech -15% on Q4 miss, guides Q1 revenues below consensus

    • Forum Energy Technologies (FET -15.6%) plunges 15% after posting a slightly larger than expected Q4 loss but guiding Q1 revenues below consensus.
    • FET says Q4 revenues rose 68% Y/Y to $247.7M but slightly missed the $249.8M analyst consensus estimate, and new orders received in the quarter came in flat at $232M.
    • FET forecasts Q1 revenues of $240M-$255M, below the $258.8M analyst consensus, and sees EBITDA of $18M-$23M.
    • "Although customer spending is off to a slow start in January, we expect activity to accelerate throughout the year," the company says.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM
  • PFLT

    Management offers its take as PennantPark Floating tumbles post-earnings

    • FQ1 net investment loss of $1.9M or $0.05 per share vs. income of $10.4M and $0.32 in FQ4. FQ1's result include $0.29 per share in credit facility amendment and debt issuance costs. Core NII per share came in at $0.25. Distributions were $0.285.
    • Dec. 31 net asset value per share of $13.86 slips from $14.10 three months earlier.
    • $176.9M put to work during quarter vs. $101.1M in FQ4. Sales and repayments of $149.1M vs. $91.7M in FQ4.
    • Conference call participants were able in real time to get management's reaction to the sharp decline in the stock (transcript here). CEO Art Penn says the quarter may be looking ugly as the company more or less re-jiggered the entire liability side of its balance sheet last quarter. The GAAP hit should be worth it though, says Penn, as the company locked in a low interest rate, and should have lower interest expenses than peers going forward.
    • Previously: PennantPark misses by $0.01, misses on net investment income (Feb. 8)
    • PFLT -7%
     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM | 10 Comments
  • FMNB

    Financials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 1:30 PM (02/09/2018)

    • Gainers: FMNB +9%. SSFN +7%.
    • Losers: CBL -16%. JTPY -14%. ARCT -8%. WPG -8%. AMRK -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:30 PM | 4 Comments
  • AMZN

    Reuters: Amazon planning Brazilian mega-warehouse

    • Amazon (AMZN -4%) wants to lease a 50K-square-meter warehouse near Sao Paulo, Brazil, according to Reuters sources.
    • Logistics company Prologis (PLD +0.5%) reportedly offered the space to Amazon. The two previously teamed up on a warehouse in Mexico. 
    • The investment would be quadruple the size of the Amazon’s current Brazilian operation, which suggests the retailer might soon move beyond books and electronics to distributing other goods in the country. 
    • E-commerce accounts for about 5% of Brazil’s $300B retail market but that share has doubled in the last four years. Analysts expect a continued double-digit annual growth. 
    • Amazon first started selling electronics in the region last October.
    • Competitors: Mercado Libre (MELI -5.1%) and B2w Chia Digital.  
    • Previously: Amazon shadow sends FedEx and UPS lower (Feb. 9)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:21 PM | 24 Comments
  • SRPT

    Sell-side bulls defend Sarepta after trial suspension-stoked drop, shares down 10%

    • Sell-side supporters of Sarepta Therapeutics (SRPT -9.7%) rush to defend the stock after an ugly down move today triggered by a report that its Phase 3 clinical trial assessing DMD candidate golodirsen (SRP-4045) has been put on temporary hold due to a safety signal. The bearish action only adds to longs' anxiety considering the stock's 25% slump since touching $68.90 on January 26.
    • JPMorgan's Anupam Rama, Goldman's Salveen Richter and Leerink's Joseph Schwartz all say the trial halt is nothing to worry about. Mr. Rama adds that the participant who developed rhabdomyolysis has resumed dosing.
    • All rate the stock a BUY with price targets ranging from $63 to $77.
    • Source: Bloomberg
    • Previously: Sarepta slips 7% premarket on golodirsen study halt (Feb. 9)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM | 9 Comments
  • HDP

    Cowen adjusts Hortonworks target after earnings, cites weak FY rev. guide

    • Cowen reiterates its Market Perform rating on Hortonworks (NASDAQ:HDP) but raises the price target by a dollar to $19, which is $0.16 above yesterday’s closing price.
    • Analyst J. Derrick Wood writes that the company made strides to improve FCF, but it remains an “overhang on valuation.” 
    • Wood remains on the sidelines due to the minimal FCF leverage and generation for FY18 and weaker billings trend visibility. 
    • The analyst notes that adopting the ASC 606 account standards created a $15M headwind for Hortonworks with revenue projected to grow 25% compared to the 42% growth last year. 
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word. 
    • Hortonworks shares are down 9.5%.       
    • Previously: Hortonworks reports Q4 revenue beat, upside guidance (Feb. 8)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:03 PM | 2 Comments
  • CMG

    Bruising week continues for Chipotle

    • Negative analyst commentary continues to linger over Chipotle (CMG -6.3%).
    • The latest into the fray is Cowen, with a new warning on sales trend based in part off of Facebook check-ins data. Analyst Andrew Charles now forecasts Q1 same-stores sales growth of +0.5% vs. +1.3% consensus and +0.5% to +1.5% CMG guidance.
    • Shares are Chipotle are down ~20% for the week.
    • Previously: Chipotle up after showing margin improvement (Feb. 6)
    • Previously: Chipotle exec talks up potential, analysts take down estimates (Feb. 7)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM | 40 Comments
  • INPX

    Midday Gainers / Losers (2/9/2018)

    • Gainers: INPX +32%. AOI +28%. CGG-OLD +24%. WAIR +24%. IO +16%. MOBL +16%. UIS +14%. PCYG +15%. AQXP +14%. MCFT +13%.
    • Losers: MGEN -22%. TNDM -20%. EXPE -19%. RMGN -17%. WEB -18%. CTXR -18%. NGL -17%. CBL -17%. SWIR -17%. CIVI -17%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM
  • GPP

    Green Plains Partners higher after Stifel upgrades to Buy

    • Green Plains Partners (GPP +1.5%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold with a $20 price target at Stifel following better than expected Q4 earnings.
    • Stifel notes GPP management reiterated its desire to expand the asset base beyond assets affiliated with Green Plains Inc. (GPRE -2.5%) and highlighted a goal of 25% of revenues being non affiliated with GPRE in the next 18 months.
    • As such, Stifel thinks GPP could invest in additional terminals that blend ethanol in various markets, adding that management previously has said a terminal delivering E-15 to local markets would have appeal.
    • Source: Briefing.com
     
     
     
     
    | 12:34 PM
  • AONNY

    SoftBank, Yahoo Japan, Aeon team on online retail venture

    • SoftBank (SFTBY +2.1%) is coming together with Yahoo Japan (YAHOY +1.1%) and Aeon (OTCPK:AONNY) to launch an online retail business to combat growing competition from Amazon.com, according to NHK.
    • The venture would sell products including food, clothes and everyday goods and combines Aeon's product range and distribution with deep customer knowledge from SoftBank and Yahoo Japan.
    • Amazon has been testing its Fresh food delivery in parts of Tokyo, part of a gradually increasing range of services in Japan.
    • Previously: Walmart partners up with Rakuten (Jan. 26 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM | 2 Comments

  • Another sharp drop in oil and energy names leads markets lower

    • WTI crude oil is down another 3.2% today, now off about 20% in the last handful of sessions, and slipping below $60 per barrel for the first time this year. USO -1.65%.
    • Alongside, the energy sector (XLE -1.9%) is leading the major averages into negative territory. Things are highly volatile though, and a turn into the green at any moment shouldn't surprise.
    • The S&P 500 is off 0.5% and the Dow 0.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM | 21 Comments
  • PYX

    Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 pm (2/9/2018)

    • Gainers: AOI +31%. MCFT +15%. MBUU +13%. EVK +9%. SGOC +7%.
    • Losers: MPAA -9%. LTRPA -8%. LBIX-OLD -8%. PETZ -7%. CSL -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:04 PM
  • INSY

    Maryland latest state to jump on Insys litigation bandwagon; shares down 5%

    • The Maryland Attorney General in the latest to accuse INSYS Therapeutics (INSY -4.6%) of misbehavior in promoting opioid pain med Subsys (fentanyl). As expected, the company takes issue with the AG's accusations, saying only 101 state residents were prescribed Subsys in 2015, only 0.0016% of the estimated 871K patients who were prescribed an opioid that year.
    • Previously: INSYS takes issue with NY AG suit over alleged misconduct with Subsys promotion (Feb. 2)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM | 1 Comment
  • SNAP

    Recode: Snap targets Instagram advertisers with free ad credits

    • Snap (SNAP -2.8%) is engaging in another program to draw advertisers from rivals by offering free ad credits, Recode reports.
    • The company's reaching out to those buying vertical video ads on Instagram (FB +0.9%) and others, who are directed to an online application where they can upload proof they bought recently from a Snapchat competitor -- and get ad credits in the range of "several hundred dollars."
    • Snap tends to sell nearly all vertical video ads through programmatic buying, Recode's Kurt Wagner notes, but with little traffic in the auctions; a bigger pool of advertisers would generate more price competition for the ads.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:33 AM | 130 Comments
  • SO

    Southern's nuke power project, biofuel producers get boost in budget deal

    • Among the energy incentives in the new budget deal just passed by U.S. lawmakers are ~$2B in tax credits that would benefit Southern Co. (SO +0.9%), which is struggling to complete two nuclear reactors in Georgia.
    • A $1/gallon tax credit for mixing biodiesel is retroactively extended through 2017, an incentive that helps producers such as Renewable Energy Group (REGI +4.9%), but Congress did not continue the biodiesel tax credit into the future.
    • A $1.01/gallon tax credit for the production of cellulosic ethanol also received a retroactive extension through 2017.
    • Carbon capture technologies are provided with subsidies to make coal plants able to compete in a carbon-constrained world.
    • The deal also calls for selling 100M barrels of oil from the U.S. Strategic Petroleum Reserve by 2027; combined with other sales approved last year, the volume of oil in the SPR would decline by 45% to 303M barrels.
    • ETFs: KOL, PBW, QCLN, PUW, HECO
     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM | 30 Comments
  • AMGN

    Biotechs continue selloff, XBI down almost 3%

    • Buyers of biotech stocks are a scarce commodity as the session approaches the two-hour mark. The SPDR S&P Biotech ETF (XBI -2.7%), for example, has dropped over 13% since touching $97.98 on January 29.
    • Selected tickers: (IBB -1.6%)(FBT -0.8%)(BBH -0.3%)(BIB -2.6%)(SBIO -2.4%)(ARKG -2.3%)(BBC -2.4%)(BBP -2.7%)(AMGN -1.3%)(BIIB -1.9%)(GILD -1.4%)(VRTX -1.8%)(CELG +0.6%)(GLPG -1%)(ALNY -3.4%)(XON -1.6%)(EDIT -5.3%)(NTLA -3.7%)(CRSP -11.8%)(BLUE -3%)(REGN -0.2%)(SGEN -2.7%)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM | 51 Comments
  • IRBT

    Sidoti points to the upside potential on iRobot

    • Sidoti steps into the mix on iRobot (IRBT -4.3%) with an upgrade to Buy after watching the stock peel more than 35% this week.
    • The analyst team sees downside risk limited at iRobot's current trading level.
    • The investment firm's price target of $90 reps +60% upside potential.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM | 9 Comments
  • WAIR

    Wesco Aircraft flies after earnings

    • Wesco Aircraft (WAIR +25.2%) soars after FQ1 revenue arrives $16M above consensus and the company records a penny beat on the bottom line.
    • Looking ahead, Wesco expects a low single-digit percent increase in sales for the full fiscal year and a low double-digit percent increase in adjusted EBITDA.
    • Previously: Wesco Aircraft beats by $0.02, beats on revenue (Feb. 8)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM

    Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 am (2/9/2018)

  • Stocks reverse big early gains, turn lower

    • Massive volatility reigns once again, with 1%+ early gains for the averages reversing into the red a bit more than an hour into the session. Things might go green before we hit the "send" button, but at the moment the S&P 500 and Nasdaq are down 0.3% and the Dow 0.8%.
    • Oil continues to tumble, down another 2% and below $60 per barrel.
    • The 10-year Treasury yield is holding steady at 2.83%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM | 23 Comments
  • ESS

    Apartment REITs in the green as bears cut bets

    • The sector is seeing three upgrades from underperform (or the equivalent) this morning, with Mizuho boosting Essex Property (ESS +2.6%), and Zelman, AvalonBay (AVB +1.1%) and Aimco (AIV +1.5%).
    • Mizuho takes note of Essex's upbeat guidance as easing Street fears.
    • Previously: Essex Property sees about 4.5% FFO growth in 2018 (Feb. 7)
    • Previously: AvalonBay meets Q4 estimates, sees 3.6% FFO growth in 2018 (Jan. 31)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:48 AM | 1 Comment
  • WEB

    Web.com -16.7% after Q4 beats, downside guidance, analyst downgrade

    • Web.com (NASDAQ:WEB) reports Q4 results with EPS and revenue that beat estimates but downside guidance.
    • Q1 guidance: Revenue, $184M to $187M (consensus: $192.10M); adjusted EBITDA, $40.5M to $42.5M. 
    • FY18 guidance: $755M to $770M ($783.43M); adjusted EBITDA, $192M to $197M. 
    • Earnings release 
    • The company also announced that CFO Kevin Carney will retire, effective June 30. 
    • Analyst action: BWS Financial downgrades Web.com from Buy to Hold with a price target of $19. 
    • Firm says Web.com’s adjustment period is taking much longer than initial estimates. 
    • Subscriber loss accelerated in Q4. The company expects more losses in Q1 as Web.com is no longer investing in low margin retail products. 
    • Firm fears further underperformance in store with management dealing with debt maturity on top of the competitive pressures of the business. 
    • Source: Briefing.com.    
    • Web.com shares are down 16.7%.
    • Previously: Web.com beats by $0.41, beats on revenue (Feb. 8)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM
  • OSK

    Oshkosh lively after Evercore nod

    • Vehicle maker Oshkosh (OSK +2%) is on the move after a timely upgrade from Evercore ISI.
    • The investment firm moves to an Outperform rating from Market Perform.
    • Evercore's price target of $100 reps 17% upside potential for shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM
  • CBOE

    Cboe slumps another 12% after earnings miss

    • It's been a rough few days for Cboe Holdings (NASDAQ:CBOE), first with the VIX blowup leading some to question the future of one of the exchange's big rainmakers, and now this morning's Q4 earnings miss.
    • Today's 11.8 decline brings this month's tumble to more than 25%.
    • Q4 results obviously include none of February's tribulations, but remind of what a powerhouse VIX is, with futures average daily trading volume in 2017 of 294K, up 23% Y/Y.
    • Previously: CBOE Holdings misses by $0.01, misses on revenue (Feb. 9)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM | 2 Comments
  • JNPR

    DOJ closes FCPA probe of Juniper Networks with no action

    • In an SEC filing, Juniper Networks (JNPR +1.6%) says it's heard from the Justice Dept. that its investigation into possible violations of the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act has closed with no action against Juniper.
    • The DOJ acknowledged Juniper's cooperation in the matter, the company says, and it adds that an SEC FCPA probe hasn't yet been resolved.
    • Meanwhile, Juniper says its chief customer officer, Vincent Molinaro, will step down. He'll serve as interim CCO until a successor is in place.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM
  • BIOA

    BioAmber to sell over 46M units in direct offering at 40% discount, public offering canceled; shares down 7%

    • BioAmber (OTC:BIOA) inks agreements with institutional investors for the aggregate sale of 46.67M Series A units (or equivalent Series B units) at a price of $0.15 per unit ($0.149/Series B unit to pay for the pre-funded warrant), 40% below its planned public offering price of $0.25 per unit.
    • The company has terminated its previously announced public offering.
    • Shares are off 7%.
    • Previously: BioAmber prices equity offering (Feb. 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM
  • MTCH

    Aegis Capital raises Match Group target to 25% upside

    • Aegis Capital raises its Match Group (NASDAQ:MTCH) price target from $32 to $42, a 25% upside on yesterday’s close.
    • Firm thinks the new guidance has a high level of built-in conservatism due to cautiousness about new Tinder monetization products launching in Q3. 
    • Aegis says Match management has executed strongly in the past year and that momentum should continue, particularly around Tinder subscriber growth and margin expansion. 
    • Source: Briefing.com. 
    • Match Group shares are up 4.1%.         
    • Previously: Match Group reports Q4 beat, upside Q1 guidance (Feb. 6)
    • Previously: Match earnings call: Plans for 2H deceleration, mentions tech patent (Feb. 7)
    • Previously: Barclays raises its Match Group price target after earnings (Feb. 8)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM | 1 Comment
  • MPAA

    Post-earnings slide for Motorcar Parts of America

    • Motorcar Parts of America (MPAA -11.9%) slumps after missing Q4 estimates by a wide margin.
    • Gross profit fell to 27.9% of sales vs. 30.1% a year ago, due to customer allowances related to new business, higher returns, lower overhead absorption and product mix.
    • "We were disappointed in our results for the quarter, especially since we continued to gain market share across all of our product lines. While we incurred additional expenses related to new business wins, we did not realize the full benefit of the associated revenues during the quarter," says CEO Selwyn Joffe.

  • PACB

    Pacific Bio down 2% premarket on ITC patent ruling

    • Pacific Biosciences (NASDAQ:PACB) slips 2% premarket on the heels of its announcement that the U.S. International Trade Commission (ITC) has terminated its investigation into whether Oxford Nanopore's MinION and PromethION devices and their consumables, reagents and software infringe on two U.S. patents (Nos. 9,404,146 and 9,542,527) owned by Pacific. The company believes Oxford's 2D method infringes on the two.
    • The ITC interpreted the term "single-molecule sequencing" as limited to sequencing-by-synthesis approaches, determining that Oxford's sequencing approach is not "single-molecule sequencing."
    • CEO Dr. Michael Hunkapiller says, “We disagree with the present determination of non-infringement in this lawsuit, and note that the ITC’s construction of the term ‘single-molecule sequencing’ is inconsistent with both the commonly understood meaning of that term as well as relevant U.S. Supreme Court and Federal Circuit precedent. We continue to stand firm in our resolve to protect our investment and leadership position in the field we have created, and we look forward to the next phases of our litigation against Oxford Nanopore in the U.S. and Europe.”

  • CBIO

    Phase 1/2 data on Catalyst Bio's hemophilia B candidate underwhelms investors, shares down 12% premarket

    • Catalyst Biosciences (NASDAQ:CBIO) slumps 12% premarket in response to its announcement of topline data from a Phase 1/2 clinical trial evaluating subcutaneous (SQ) administration of hemophilia B candidate CB 2679d/ISU304. The results were presented at the European Association for Hemophilia and Allied Disorders (EAHAD) Annual Congress in Madrid.
    • After six days of SQ dosing in five patients with severe hemophilia B, CB 2679d increased factor IX (FIX) levels to a median of 16% (range: 11.5 - 18%), within the mild hemophilia range (5 - 40%). The observed increase in FIX levels was linear so the company says continued dosing may achieve more significant results.
    • The SQ half-life was 63.2 hours, significantly lower than 98.7 hours reported in December.
    • Previously: Catalyst Bio up 13% on positive Phase 1/2 data on hemophilia B candidate (Dec. 11, 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:46 AM | 2 Comments

  • SRPT

    Sarepta slips 7% premarket on golodirsen study halt

    • Sarepta Therapeutics (NASDAQ:SRPT) is down 7% premarket in reaction to the news that it has temporarily suspended dosing in a late-stage study of DMD candidate golodirsen.
    • The study, ESSENCE, is evaluating exon 45-skipping SRP-4045 (golodirsen) and exon 53-skipping SRP-4053.
    • Apparently, one patient experienced a painful side effect called rhabdomyolysis, a condition where skeletal muscle breaks down rapidly. The dead cells are released into the bloodstream where they can cause serious problems.
    • EP Vantage reports that the safety data from ESSENCE has been reviewed by an independent monitoring committee which concluded that dosing could continue for all participants.
